WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
The radical and the kanji for direction are the same! Huzzah!
There is also another meaning too, though. This can also mean way as well. Think of it this way: When you move in one direction in your life, you are developing your own way. "The way of [your name here]."
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The only direction you need to go in is forward, it's always the right way.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What direction do you always know? Which direction do you always want to go? Home („Åª„ÅÜ). Something about your home always stays with you, no matter how far away you go. So if you're lost and you don't know which direction to go, just think of home!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Close your eyes and picture your home in your mind. Can you tell which direction it is from where you are?

humanum_full_description_en:
The oracle-bone inscriptions and inscriptions of the Chinese character " fang " are roughly the same in configuration. They all start from "‰∏Ä" from " sword ". Ancient Chinese characters use " ‚ñ° " to indicate the " square " of the circle, but because " ‚ñ° " is easy to follow " ding " in ancient Chinese characters The writing method of the outline is mixed with the initial writing of the word " circle ", so the borrowed word " fang " was used to express the " fang " of the square circle very early. " Fang " and "Death (mang)" are made according to the same principle. Both use "‰∏Ä" to indicate the sharpness of " sword ", and the two characters are similar in ancient pronunciation, which proves that the two characters are of the same origin. Later, the ancients borrowed the original text of the ideographic meaning of the sharp " mang " to express the " square " of the square circle, so the word " fang " was differentiated. See " death ".

For the " square " configuration of the original meaning of the word there are other claims, such as Ye Yusen thought like " knife " hanging on the rack-shaped; Zhu Fang Po that " party " is " Fang Wen-Chu" to " a " indicator Holding " knife " The place is the same as that of the knife. The point indicated by "‰∏Ä" is the blade, not the handle. All theories do not seem to conform to the " square " shape. As for Xu Zhongshu's view that the word " fang " resembles the shape of " Lei ", He Linyi thinks that the image " one " is across the body of the " sword ", indicating that the knife is used to divide things.

The word " fang " in oracle bone inscriptions is used as the square of the four directions, such as "Heji" 28190: "In the West, Dongxiang (xiang)." "Heji" 30394: "Qi (you) in the four directions", which refers to the yor sacrifice in the four directions. " Fang " can also be used as a general term for Fang Guo. "Compilation" 36536: "It cuts the Fang." "Tunnan" 2301: "Fang Lai Jiang" means Fang Guolai surrendered. The word "Fang Bai (Bo)" is often used in oracle bone inscriptions, which refers to the leader of the Fang country. "Compilation" 28086: "Wang Qixun two Fang Bai (Bo)", that is, the king uses two heads of Fang country as a sacrifice. See " search ".

Bronze " square " refers to square, opposite to " circle ". Shi La Fang Ding: "Shi Da Zha (made) Bao Fang Ding." Or it can be used to calculate the land area, such as calling the Âç£: "Appreciate the earthwork for fifty miles", "Four square miles" means two thousand five hundred square miles (Tang Lan) . The whole sentence refers to the reward given to Bi 2,500 square miles. "Mencius. "Liang Hui Wang": "A place is a hundred miles away, but you can be king." " Fang " can be used as a direction, if not °¢Å£™ï: "Suo Fang Yan (ÁéÅ) Yun (ÁãÅ) Guangxi Yu (ÈöÖ)." "Suo Fang" Refers to the north, see " Sho ". The whole sentence refers to the large-scale attack on the western land by the hawks in the north. " Fang " also refers to the country of Fang. For example, "Ren Fang" and "Ghost Fang" are all Fang country names. Xiaozi £™ï: "Èöπ¢¶ö order to attack people" means ¢¶ö order to attack people. " Fang " can be used as an adverb of time to mean just now. Zhongshan Wangding: "Han (now) She (Yu) Fangzhuang" means that I just grew up now. "Guang Ya. Interpretation of "Fang": "Fang, Shi Ye." " Fang " can also be used as a name.

The word " fang " in the Qin bamboo slips can represent the wood block used in ancient writing, "Sleeping Tiger Di Qin Slips. Eighteen kinds of Qin laws. Sagong" Jane 131: "For those who order the county and the capital to take the willow and the wood (soft), the book is available." The entire sentence instructs the county and the capital to use willow or other soft wood to cut into wood Party for writing. "Rituals. "The Engagement Ceremony": "There are more than a hundred books in Ce, but not as good as a hundred books in Fang." Zheng Xuan's note: "Ce, Jian Ye; Fang, Ban Ye." Ancient people wrote medicine in Mu Fang, and there is still the word "prescription" in modern Chinese. (Qiu Xigui).

"Shuowen": "Fang, and boats. It is like a province with two boats, with a head shape. All the sides belong to the Fang. Ê±∏, Fang or Congshui." According to the "Suowen", it is not the original meaning of the word " fang ". .
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jin inscription from " one " to " sword ", with " one " indicating the edge of the " sword ", the original meaning is the edge of the knife, and later borrowed as the " square " (Qiu Xigui).

The oracle-bone inscriptions and inscriptions of the Chinese character " fang" are roughly the same in configuration. They all start from " ‰∏Ä" from " sword". Ancient Chinese characters use " ‚ñ°" to indicate the " square" of the circle, but because " ‚ñ°" is easy to follow " ding" in ancient Chinese characters The writing method of the outline is mixed with the initial writing of the word " circle", so the borrowed word " fang" was used to express the " fang" of the square circle very early. " Fang" and "Death (mang)" are made according to the same principle. Both use " ‰∏Ä" to indicate the sharpness of " sword", and the two characters are similar in ancient pronunciation, which proves that the two characters are of the same origin. Later, the ancients borrowed the original text of the ideographic meaning of the sharp " mang" to express the " square" of the square circle, so the word " fang" was differentiated. See " death". The word " fang" in oracle bone inscriptions is used as the square of the four directions, such as "Heji" 28190: "In the West, Dongxiang (xiang)." (14) Surrounded. Also refers to boundaries or boundaries.
(15) Place; Region.

(17) Antiquity refers to states. Also refers to the state of the ancient administrative region.

Radicals: Êñπ  (direction)
Meaning Mnemonic
The radical and the kanji for direction are the same! Huzzah!
There is also another meaning too, though. This can also mean way as well. Think of it this way: When you move in one direction in your life, you are developing your own way. "The way of [your name here]."
The only direction you need to go in is forward, it's always the right way.
Reading Mnemonic
What direction do you always know? Which direction do you always want to go? Home („Åª„ÅÜ). Something about your home always stays with you, no matter how far away you go. So if you're lost and you don't know which direction to go, just think of home!
Close your eyes and picture your home in your mind. Can you tell which direction it is from where you are?
